recipe.name: Beef Sunday Roast
recipe.description: A traditional British Sunday meal featuring roasted beef, crispy potatoes, tender broccoli, carrots, and classic Yorkshire puddings.
steps: Preheat the oven to 230°C (210°C fan) or gas mark 8.
Place the beef and potatoes in a roasting tray, drizzle with sunflower oil, and roast for 45 minutes, checking regularly to prevent overcooking.
Boil the broccoli and carrots in a pan of water until tender, then drain and set aside.
For the Yorkshire puddings, drizzle a little sunflower oil evenly into a 12-hole non-stick muffin tin and place in the oven to heat through.
In a bowl, beat the plain flour and eggs until smooth. Gradually add the milk, continuing to beat until the mixture is completely lump-free. Season with salt and pepper.
Pour the batter into a jug. Remove the hot muffin tin from the oven and carefully pour the batter evenly into the holes.
Place the tin back in the oven and bake undisturbed for 20-25 minutes until the puddings have puffed up and browned. Serve immediately.
Plate the roasted beef, potatoes, broccoli, and carrots. Add the Yorkshire puddings and gravy as desired.
A chef’s work is never done—but for now, enjoy your delicious reward!
